properties.name: Helen Betty Osborne Foundation and Naming Recognitions
properties.description:
The Helen Betty Osborne Memorial Fund

The Helen Betty Osborne Memorial Fund recognizes Indigenous students who are making a difference in eliminating the barriers of racism, sexism, violence, and indifference in society. The scholarship fund was established to honour her memory and provide financial assistance to Indigenous students. It is currently managed by The Winnipeg Foundation.

Naming Recognitions

The University of Winnipeg named the building housing the Wii Chiiwaakanak Learning Centre and other Indigenous education initiatives the “Helen Betty Osborne Building.” This naming recognized Helen Betty and Indigenous women who have experienced violence, and acknowledged her as a symbol of hope for young Indigenous adults due to her commitment to education.

properties.name: Helen Betty Osborne Ininew Education Resource Center
properties.description:
The Helen Betty Osborne Ininew Education Resource Centre, Norway House, MB


The Helen Betty Osborne Ininew Education Resource Centre in Helen Betty's home community of Norway House is one of the largest First Nations schools in Canada. It's a comprehensive K-12 school that provides closer-to-home educational opportunities for students from multiple communities, and opened in 2004 following extensive planning, design, and construction.
